intro: Jurinea neumayeriana, commonly known as the Neumayer's sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive blue or violet flowers and silver-gray leaves that reflect sunlight. This plant thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand harsh coastal conditions. It is often found growing in dunes or along the shoreline, where it plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes. Jurinea neumayeriana is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
